abstract: New details emerge about Marco Rubio's role as ambassador to conservative media in 2013 as he sought to protect legislation on immigration reform from negative coverage;  Rubio met both with Fox News executives and radio host Rush Limbaugh, who together held strong influence over Republican party's anti-immigrant base; role could prove embarrassment for Rubio in his presidential bid.
lead_paragraph: In 2013, Senator Marco Rubio appealed to News Corporation executives and Rush Limbaugh, the talk radio host, on behalf of legislation that would have provided a path to citizenship for 11 million immigrants.

headline.main: Marco Rubio Pushed for Immigration Reform With Conservative Media
headline.print_headline: Rubio Pushed for an Overhaul of Immigration Policy With Conservative Media

snippet: In 2013, Senator Marco Rubio appealed to News Corporation executives and Rush Limbaugh, the talk radio host, on behalf of legislation that would have provided a path to citizenship for 11 million immigrants.
